p.style: line-height: 23px; letter-spacing: 0.3px; margin: 0px 0px 15px;
line-height: 23px; font-family: inherit; letter-spacing: 0.3px; margin: 0px 0px 6px;

span.style: caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 14.6667px; text-size-adjust: auto;

p.style: text-align: center; caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: -webkit-standard; line-height: 23.4px; margin: 0in 0in 0.0001pt;
caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: -webkit-standard; line-height: 23.4px; margin: 0in 0in 0.0001pt;
text-align: justify; margin-bottom: 10pt; line-height: 16.8667px; font-family: Rockwell, serif;
text-align: justify; line-height: 16.8667px; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Rockwell, serif;
line-height: 16.8667px; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Rockwell, serif;
text-align: justify; line-height: normal; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Rockwell, serif;

span.p: Since we first learned that this pandemic was on the horizon, we made a decision that we would work as partners to help the residents and students of Enfield get through this crisis the best that we could. I cant tell you how much I appreciate having you there with me as we collaboratively made major decisions that impacted the entire community. Whether it was being one of the first in the state to close schools or declare a State of Emergency, we have stood shoulder to shoulder during this incredible time in our history with one common goal in mind, doing whats best for the people of Enfield. Your partnership has also helped foster a spirt of collaboration between town and school departments, with all of us working together to get through these trying times. Just one example is our school motorcades, giving kids an opportunity to have a moment of normalcy to see their teachers from a distance. But these events couldnt happen without the overwhelming support from the Enfield Police and Fire Departments, which were able to contribute because of your support. The Town of Enfield and the Enfield Public Schools have done a remarkable job meeting the needs of the entire community in these extraordinary times and every resident should be extremely proud of their towns effort. I know I speak for you when I say that we couldnt be prouder to serve the people of Enfield, and we are extremely fortunate to have the people working for the town and the schools to help us through this journey.

p.style: text-align: justify; line-height: normal; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Rockwell, serif;

span.p: Although were still dealing with a public health crisis, we know that our work continues and the ramifications of this pandemic will have a significant financial impact on the town in the days to come. Like we have done since the beginning, we have been working together daily to address the needs of the community, while recognizing the reality of the economic impact. In the same spirit of partnership, I recognize that an increase to the Board of Educations budget request is not something that is feasible at this time. The people of Enfield have shown us that even during the of worst times, we may bend, but we wont break. A flat funding of the districts budget will put a strain on the system, but I dont believe it will break us. Although this isnt something we can sustain every year, I believe that we can help the community weather the storm this year and do our part to help the town during this uncertain time. I believe we can accomplish this with keeping our two major priorities intact; minimal impact on student programs and not laying off any staff members. We may not be able to do all the things we were hoping to with our original request, but as long as we can meet the most important goals that Ive mentioned above, we will continue to do our best. In the event the State honors their commitments down the road, I would restore any cuts that are needed to be made, but in the meantime we can make the required reductions through attrition and not have to lay any employees off. I have shared this with district leadership and everyone is willing to do their part to help get through this.

p.style: text-align: justify; line-height: normal; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Rockwell, serif;

span.p: Ive never been more confident that we will get through this, and that we will be stronger on the other side. As long as we continue to stick together, our community will be in position to thrive once this cloud is lifted. In the meantime, feel free to share this with council if you believe its appropriate. I thank you again for your partnership, but more importantly your friendship as we continue to do great things for the Town of Enfield.

p.a: Makena Schwab, Senior at EHS created this animation while at home during our school closure. She is a consistent inspiration to her teachers and peers in Enfield Highs Visual Arts Department. Makena hopes this animation brings some joy and inspiration into your life too. Next year at college, shes continuing her study of the Fine Arts.

p.style: color:#c9c8cd; font-family:Arial,sans-serif; font-size:14px; line-height:17px; margin-bottom:0; margin-top:8px; overflow:hidden; padding:8px 0 7px; text-align:center; text-overflow:ellipsis; white-space:nowrap;

div.p: A post shared by Enfield Public Schools (@enfieldps) on Apr 5, 2020 at 4:38pm PDT

p.style: text-align: center; margin: 0in 0in 0.0001pt; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-size-adjust: auto;
text-align: center; margin: 0in 0in 0.0001pt; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-size-adjust: auto;
text-align: center; font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Bookman Old Style", serif;
text-align: center; font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Bookman Old Style", serif;

img.alt: Welcome Back to TEAMs and Distance Learning Projects

span.style: font-family: source_sans_prolight; font-size: xxx-large; font-weight: 400; text-align: center;
font-family: source_sans_prolight; font-size: xxx-large; font-weight: 400; text-align: center;

img.alt: Welcome Back to TEAMs and Distance Learning Projects

p.style: text-size-adjust: auto; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;
p.strong: Enfield Public Schools would like to share with you the following:

p.style: text-size-adjust: auto; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;

li.strong: We recognize that the current public health emergency is resulting in an increase of stress on families.
If you or your child are experiencing an immediate safety concern call 911.
If you or your child are experiencing a behavioral mental health crisis call 211.
If you would like to access support services, please contact the following:
For children over 8 years of age, please call Youth and Family Services at 860-253-6380.
For children under 8 years of age, please call the Family Resource Center 860-253-5214.
If you would like to contact your childs counselor or social worker, please do so via their school email address.

p.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Bookman Old Style", serif; text-align: justify;

strong.style: font-size: 10pt; caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: -webkit-standard; text-align: start; text-size-adjust: auto;

span.style: caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: -webkit-standard; font-size: medium; text-align: start; text-size-adjust: auto;

p.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Bookman Old Style", serif; text-align: justify;

strong.style: caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: -webkit-standard; text-align: start; text-size-adjust: auto;

span.style: caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: -webkit-standard; font-size: medium; text-align: start; text-size-adjust: auto;

br.style: caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: -webkit-standard; text-align: start; text-size-adjust: auto;

p.style: caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: -webkit-standard; text-size-adjust: auto;

hr.p: When children and youth watch news on TV about an infectious disease outbreak, read about it in the news, or overhear others discussing it, they can feel scared, confused, or anxiousas much as adults. This is true even if they live far from where the outbreak is taking place and are at little to no actual risk of getting sick. Young people react to anxiety and stress differently than adults. Some may react right away; others may show signs that they are having a difficult time much later. As such, adults do not always know when a child needs help. This tip sheet will help parents, caregivers, and teachers learn some common reactions, respond in a helpful way, and know when to seek support.

p.style: caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: -webkit-standard; text-size-adjust: auto;
caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: -webkit-standard; text-size-adjust: auto;
font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Bookman Old Style", serif; text-align: justify;
font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Bookman Old Style", serif; text-align: justify;
font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Bookman Old Style", serif; text-align: justify;
font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Bookman Old Style", serif; text-align: justify;
p.span: Recent events have raised concerns about the prevention of contagious infections like the flu and the coronavirus. Hand washing has been identified by the Center for Disease Control (CDC) as the most effective way to prevent the spread of these infections. In our efforts to keep students healthy, proper hand washing techniques are being reviewed with students. Healthy habits begin at home, and so we are hoping you will join us in our efforts and help your child maintain the most effective hand washing techniques at home as well.

p.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Bookman Old Style", serif; text-align: justify;
p.span: Below you will find effective hand washing skills outlined in the CDCs
p.em: Life is Better with Clean Hands

p.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Bookman Old Style", serif; text-align: justify;
p.span: Washing your hands is easy, and its one of the most effective ways to prevent the spread of germs. Studies have shown that handwashing can prevent 1 in 3 diarrhea-related sicknesses and 1 in 5 respiratory infections, such as a cold or the flu.

p.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif; background: white;
p.span: Follow these five steps every time.

li.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Bookman Old Style", serif; background: white;

strong.span: your hands with clean, running water (warm or cold), turn off the tap, and apply soap.

li.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Bookman Old Style", serif; background: white;

strong.span: your hands by rubbing them together with the soap. Lather the backs of your hands, between your fingers, and under your nails.

li.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Bookman Old Style", serif; background: white;

strong.span: your hands for at least 20 seconds. Need a timer? Hum the Happy Birthday song from beginning to end twice.

li.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Bookman Old Style", serif; background: white;

strong.span: your hands well under clean, running water.

li.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Bookman Old Style", serif; background: white;

strong.span: your hands using a clean towel or air dry them.

p.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif; background: white;
p.span: If soap and water arent available, you can use an alcohol-based hand sanitizer that contains at least 60% alcohol.

p.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif; background: white;

em.span: Life is Better with Clean Hands

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Bookman Old Style", serif; color: rgb(7, 82, 144);

p.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Bookman Old Style", serif; text-align: justify;

font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Bookman Old Style", serif; text-align: justify;
